availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Delia A. Haden Judy. Father of Samuel H. Judy, Andrew H. Judy, Elizabeth Jane Judy, Margaret Catherine Judy, Thomas Judy, Mary F. Judy, Ida E. Judy, and Eddie Judy. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed John W. Mason, Abram Olson, and Peter Hart as laborers in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Hired one enslaved person, Dallas, from John R. Wilson in Montgomery County for 1862. Hired one enslaved person, Dall, from John R. Wilson in Montgomery County for 1863. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
